intro: Streptocarpus formosus, commonly known as the Formosa streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Taiwan. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring fleshy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for indoor cultivation.
